title: Wrong invoiced data
description: One instance got created on May 7-th ( viralrocks.trypl.com ) and on the invoice appeared the bucket for the 15 days free trial, one line with + one line with minus for the period 7-21-st may, then it only invoiced the subscription for June, skipping to invoice the period for 21-31-st may which costs us money

title: When creating a subscription the customer should be taken from URL
description: Subscriptions have endpoint in the form: `customers/:id/subscriptions`. So, when creating a subscription, the customer must match the one in the URL and it shouldn't be settable through POST data.
text_for_topic_modeling: creating subscription customer taken url subscriptions endpoint form customers subscriptions creating subscription customer must match one url settable post data
combined_text: When creating a subscription the customer should be taken from URL Subscriptions have endpoint in the form: `customers/:id/subscriptions`. So, when creating a subscription, the customer must match the one in the URL and it shouldn't be settable through POST data.

title: Wrong data in invoices/proforma when subscription is canceled
description: So in the middle of the month the customer decides to move. We cancel the subscription in billing and the expected result is that the new billing cycle invoice to have only the extra pageviews included on it and no more full month subscription. Well, the Billing subscription moved to ended, but the current month subscription package got invoiced wrongly on top of the expected extra pageviews.
text_for_topic_modeling: wrong data invoices proforma subscription canceled middle month customer decides move cancel subscription billing expected result new billing cycle invoice extra pageviews included full month subscription well billing subscription moved ended current month subscription package got invoiced wrongly top expected extra pageviews
combined_text: Wrong data in invoices/proforma when subscription is canceled So in the middle of the month the customer decides to move. We cancel the subscription in billing and the expected result is that the new billing cycle invoice to have only the extra pageviews included on it and no more full month subscription. Well, the Billing subscription moved to ended, but the current month subscription package got invoiced wrongly on top of the expected extra pageviews.
